intro: Crotalaria francoisiana, commonly known as the Francois's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, and the plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment. However, some species within the genus Crotalaria are toxic, so caution is advised when handling or consuming any part of the plant.
